paragraph.taxonomicName: Odontomachus ruficeps, Sm., race acutidens, For.

subSubSection.paragraph: Entirely castaneous; funiculus brown-yellow; wings iridescent, tinged with yellow; nervures brown-yellow.
, A few hairs on the head, thorax, pedicel, and gaster; whole body (including legs and antennae) covered with a thin pubescence.

Eyes occupy more than 3/4 of the sides of head. Antennae similarly formed to haematoda, Ltr., and fully as long as whole body. The two surfaces of epinotum equal, the declivity feebly concave, the angle joining them rounded and low. Node conical, as in haematoda. Gaster long and curved, slightly constricted between first and second segments.

Sculpture similar to that of haematoda, but much fainter, and on the scutum the sculpture is transverse or, at least, diverging from the centre line, whereas in haematoda it is more or less longitudinal. The epinotum is similarly sculptured to the scutum - i. e., quite superficially, not coarsely rugose as in haematoda.
[[queen]] (hitherto undescribed). Length (excluding mandibles) 10.0 mm.; length of mandibles l.5 mm.

Except for sexual differences is very similar to the [[worker]] major. In the [[worker]] minor (length 6.5 mm.), the spine on the node is almost straight, but in the [[worker]] major, and especially in the [[queen]], the spine has a decided backward bend.

The pronotum is transversely striate, the striae encirclingthe sides and the central ones doubling back on themselves; the scutum is longitudinally striate, also the scutellum, but much more finely than the scutum. Epinotum is more coarsely transversely striate, as in the [[worker]], and the node has faint striae encircling the base.
Wings are iridescent, with a yellow tinge; nervures yellow-brown.
Dr. Forel has seen specimens of the [[worker]] [[worker]], and confirms my identification of the subspecies.
